page.description: Fires when the app receives a message from the Pusher service.

discussion.p: The *[ui:onPusherMessage]* client-side event is triggered when a message from *[extlink:Pusher@http://www.pusher.com]* is received. Pusher is a 3rd-party service that allows you to build real-time applications without the complexity of using web-sockets.

description.p: An object passed to the event that contains the following properties:

property.name: channel
property.description: The channel the message was received on.

videos.title: Real-time Messaging using the Pusher Service

description.p: Real-time applications are typically built using web-sockets. However, it can be tricky to set up web-socket applications, especially if your application is behind a load balancer. The 3rd party *[extlink:Pusher service@http://www.pusher.com]* makes it very easy to build real-time applications that allow you to broadcast messages on a 'channel'. All clients that subscribe to that channel will receive the message.
In this video, we show how the UX component can be configured for real-time applications using the Pusher service.

videos.title: Real-time Location Reporting using the Pusher Service

description.p: In this video, we show how to build a real-time location reporting application using the Pusher service. When a user 'reports' their location, a marker is automatically added to a map control showing the location of the user.
